item.title: The Origin of Wealth: Complexity Economics - Beinhocker 2007*
item.description: Summary 1st difference: Dynamics 2nd difference: Agents 3rd difference: Networks 4th difference: Emergence 5th difference: Evolution If you want to see the code for this post then you can find the .Rmd file here. Summary In the first section of The Origin of Wealth Beinhocker outlines 5 key differences between traditional (neoclassical) economics and complexity economics: Dynamics Agents Networks Emergence Evolution I’ll try to illustrate each in turn (the emphasised summaries heading each section are taken from Beinhocker without adaptation).
